alert.note: Alert for Arkansas; Cleburne; Faulkner; Grant; Hot Spring; Jackson; Jefferson; Lonoke; Prairie; Pulaski; Saline; White; Woodruff (Arkansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 10 at 12:58PM CDT by NWS Little Rock
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of central Prairie, Lonoke, Grant, Jefferson, northwestern Woodruff, southwestern Jackson, southern Cleburne, eastern Faulkner, White, southeastern Saline, southeastern Hot Spring, Pulaski and west central Arkansas Counties through 130 PM CDT... At 1257 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Pleasant Plains to near Protho Junction to near Leola. Movement was east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Little Rock... North Little Rock... Pine Bluff... Benton... Sherwood... Jacksonville... Cabot... Searcy... West Little Rock... Maumelle... Bryant... Downtown Little Rock... Heber Springs... Sheridan... Lonoke... Des Arc... Hazen... North Little Rock Airport... Little Rock AFB... Southwest Little Rock... MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.

area.areaDesc: Arkansas; Cleburne; Faulkner; Grant; Hot Spring; Jackson; Jefferson; Lonoke; Prairie; Pulaski; Saline; White; Woodruff
